content.content: Last night, @rune and I attended a live debate hosted by The Chopping Block (Unchained) on the future of MakerDAO. We discussed Maker’s business model, implications of the TC sanctions on Maker’s collateral strategy, our different approaches to governance, and more. Watch: The Chopping Block Live! - with Hasu & Rune - YouTube

Thanks for all the work you do for MakerDAO Hasu  The best way to solve issues is to talk about them, it may sound simple but too often in this world people don’t talk and just declare war, diplomacy is always the best solution. I want to commend you for putting out your vision for MakerDAO in a clear and concise way!

This was a great debate. I think we should have more discussions in this format to promote getting to the heart of disagreements. Healthy and open debate is the key to getting the best outcomes possible by finding weaknesses in your own arguments and improving.
+1 completely agree. there is more similarity than difference IMHO.
Maker could benefit for more structured debates like this. Having a moderator who can ask clarifying questions and keep things moving made this much more informative.
Happy to do more debates in the future if it helps us move toward a consensus.

Unchained Podcast – 11 Aug 22    The Chopping Block: How to Manage MakerDAO, With Hasu and Rune - Ep.383 Welcome to The Chopping Block! Crypto insiders Haseeb Qureshi, Tom Schmidt, and Robert Leshner chop it up about the latest news in the digital asset industry. In this episode, Hasu,[...]  Est. reading time: 2 minutes       Blowing up all over the internet!

MakerMan delegate platform   was pretty disappointed in both of them. Rune definitely has a better command of Maker   @flipflopflapdelegate @MakerMan could you elaborate on this? Curious what I got wrong. (Feel free to respond on Discord if you prefer that over forum)

Cant go to war with the banking system when you have token voting. Money printer = unlimited tokens. Bring an existential threat to any Trillion dollar industry and they will rationally spend up to a trillion to stop it. Perhaps its not existential, in which case the rational spend is equal to potential market share. Thucydides Trap - Wikipedia I would pick Nikolai but he doesnt vote. Does Rune vote?  Who to delegate to that will vote to give themselves less power?

Hasu:  @ElProgreso @MakerMan could you elaborate on this? Curious what I got wrong. (Feel free to respond on Discord if you prefer that over forum)   No, it’s all good–the Video was Edited, so it’s hard to remember word for word what I heard live, to what has been released. But, also I’ll be Monday Morning Quaterbacking it, just like you and Rune pointed out stuff that the DAO couldn’t avoid (like CU contingency budgeting) in the early days. I’m sure we can agree that Building a DAO is an opaque goal. I also shouldn’t expect someone who has not been in the grind day in day out to know the sentiment of the community. Perhaps similar to me joining the Lido/Flashbots communities once a week (as an example),  and trying to represent the community’s diverse sentiment. As an example at 11:30 of the recording you mention that MakerDAO is a BANK. I can tell you many community members (pretty sure it will be over 51%) don’t ever want MakerDAO to be reference as a “Bank.” In fact some cringe at the sound of Maker being labelled as a “bank.” But again, all good–its a matter of opinions. You also mentioned that DAI should be backed by only Liquid Collateral Types like RWAs. You and I both know that most RWAs are liquid as a Brick  – hard to dispose. But okay… Tomato, Tomatoe. There was a moment that was edited out, where I can tell your knowledge of the inner workings of the Maker’s core component ( Vat) is lacking. But that’s to be expected as I myself lack the knowledge that a Maker OG might possess. And I’m pretty sure when it comes to Flashbots you can round circles around me. Again, all good–we live in the same building, but have different views.

I mean referring to MakerDAO as a bank on a podcast where people may not know what Maker is or does it probably the best way to describe it. I agree calling Maker a bank does not resonate with me or most of the community, but it’s the best term that people from outside the ecosystem would resonate with
